required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Multiple Gingival Recession Defects Using a New Xenogenic Collagen Membrane Compared to Connective Tissue Graft: a Randomized Controlled Split-mouth Clinical Study
clinical_study.official_title: Mucogain Matrix Versus Connective Tissue Graft: "MUCOGREFFE Project"

brief_summary.textblock: Limitation of donor site and significant postoperative morbidity are often described in connective tissue graft. We want to show if mucogain matrix used in tunnel technique to recover RTI Cairo recessions defects could be an alternative to connective tissue graft

primary_outcome.measure: Mean root coverage obtained with both techniques
primary_outcome.description: To compare the mean root coverage obtained with the Creos® Mucogain matrix and connective tissue graft in the treatment of Cairo RT1 class maxillary recessions (Miller Class 1).

secondary_outcome.description: To compare postoperative pain with both techniques
To compare the occurrence of postoperative complications (haemorrhage, edema) within the first 10 days.

arm_group.description: The patient will receive mucogain matrix on right side and connective tissue graft on left side.
The patient will receive mucogain matrix on left side and connective tissue graft on right side.

intervention.description: Patients will have a surgery for their gingival recessions. They will be enrolled in the split mouth-study. They will have on one side mucogain matrix transplant, an on another side they will have the gold standard procedure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Patient with 3 contiguous, symmetrical and bilateral RTI Cairo gingival recessions (Miller Class 1) (i.e. 6 recessions)
- Patient non-smoker
- Patient affiliated to social security
- Patient signed informed consent.
Exclusion criteria:
- Patient with or having presented an acute or chronic severe cardiovascular, kidney, liver, gastrointestinal, allergic, endocrine, neuropsychiatric pathology, developed cancer of the upper aero digestive tract treated with radiotherapy
- Patient with severe hemorrhinopathy
- Patient treated with oral retinoids, bisphosphonates, oral or anticonvulsants
- Patient who has taken steroidal or non-steroidal anti-inflammatory therapy, anti-cancer or immunosuppressive chemotherapy within the last 6 months.
- Patient with contraindication to necessary and pre-, per- or post-operative treatments
- Follow-up of the patient seemed difficult by the investigator
- Patient with insufficient oral hygiene incompatible with oral surgery

overall_contact.last_name: Laetitia I Imbert de la Phalecque
